author: Sandwhale Gaming

text: Favorite Game to date. Nothing has been able to replace this game as my favorite. I am sad that they went against making this bigger. I still replay it form time to time. I've had the game since the age i first started learning how to read. I remember when a guard called out "BASTARD" and I sounded it out and my mom was like "thats a bad word" haha. But yes my favorite game. I've replayed it so many times i can type out almost every detail of the whole story and its still not old to me
author: Turtle Shell

text: Love this soundtrack so much. LoD soundtrack is one of my favorites
author: Nihilius

text: My 2nd RPG ever right after Final Fantasy IX which I rented the same night. That was a good weekend.
author: jackal27

text:
I can believe Sony hasn't continued the series. Legend of Dragoon was a terrible game, and I've played like two dozen RPGs better than it on the Playstation alone.

Nothing wrong with the game's music, though. It has some good tracks.
author: Adam Epp

text: +Adam Epp It's nice to see that someone shares the sentiment. It's definitely not a badly made game, but as far as everything else it was just barely average. The battle and boss themes are incredibly repetitive, the story doesn't pick up until much later, and the battles usually just drag on dragoon (hahahah... ah...). It's just... eh.
author: Song Of Ourselves

text: +DracXBelmont : I remember when the game came out. It was during the time when a classic RPG was released for the Playstation nearly every month. There was a reason this game never caught on; compared to what came out in the same era, Legend of Dragoon sucks, plain and simple.
author: Adam Epp

text: +Adam Epp I had some damn good 7-8/10 fun with it, but okay, more objectively, its a 6-7/10 tops. Which is actually how it often got rated at the time.
author: Malcolm Swoboda

text: I almost beat this game, then gave up after the virage whats-it. Seems like it would be worth replaying, as the epic scale of the journey/story and all the diverse locales were the best parts of it. I actually felt like I was being immersed in the game, as opposed to the Final Fantasy titles of that generation (aside from IX, which was great).

text: Is this your favorite game SupraDarky? Everytime I go through this game and beat it I'm like, 'that's enough LOD for me.
